page.title: 20LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: The local history of the area has been dominated by the occupants of Englefield House. They have owned most of the land in the area and been actively farming it since the early medieval period. In the 16th century the Englefield family were Roman Catholic recusants and were dispossessed of their estates in the reign of Queen Elizabeth I. A succession of people held the house and the estate until it came into the Benyon family in the 18th century. Since then, and particularly in the 19th century, the Benyons were improving landlords. Many of the churches and most of the social clubs in the area were built by the family and they built houses of a very high standard for their workers. The present occupant of Englefield House is William Benyon M.P..
